headline: Taqueria Style Tacos - Carne Asada
description: This Mexican steak taco recipe is for authentic taqueria-style carne asada tacos made with flavorsome marinated steak and served on soft tortillas.

video.description: See how to make authentic taqueria-style beef tacos.
video.name: Taqueria-Style Tacos (Carne Asada)

name: Taqueria Style Tacos - Carne Asada

recipeInstructions.text: Lay flank steak in a large glass baking dish.

Make the marinade: Whisk soy sauce, oil, vinegar, 4 cloves of garlic, juice of two limes, salt, black pepper, white pepper, garlic powder, chili powder, oregano, cumin, and paprika together in a bowl until well blended; pour over steak, turning to coat both sides. Cover the dish with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator for 1 to 8 hours.
Make the relish: Stir onion, cilantro, and lime juice together in a small bowl. Set aside.

Make the salsa: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Add chile pods and toast for a few minutes; transfer pods to a bowl of water and soak for 30 minutes.

Place tomatoes, 1 onion, 4 cloves of garlic, and jalapeños onto a baking sheet. Roast in the preheated oven until vegetables are toasted, about 20 minutes. Transfer vegetables into a blender or food processor. Add soaked chiles, salt, and pepper; puree until smooth.
Remove steak from the marinade and shake off excess. Discard the remaining marinade. Cut the marinated flank steak into cubes or strips.
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add steak; cook and stir until cooked through and most of the liquid has evaporated.
Warm tortillas in a dry skillet over low heat for about a minute on each side.
Place some steak on each tortilla; top with relish and prepared salsa. Sprinkle with cotija cheese. Garnish with lime wedges and serve.

review.reviewBody: Followed exactly minus the salsa - as I already have homemade salsa to use - so skipped steps 4 & 5. But the meat and onion relish? Made exactly and this is AWESOME!!! Authentic? I don’t know and don’t care because this was so delish! I did sauté a red pepper and thinly sliced jalapeño to top. Will absolutely make again. Thank YOU stanicks!!

Great recipe for carna asada! Marinade made the texture of the flank steak perfect. It had great flavor too. Note to self, cut the chunks smaller - bite size or smaller. Next time, I would cook the jalapeno, onion, and garlic with some oil and use as a garnish and I would skip making it into the salsa. It was a lot of extra ingredients, steps, and the taste wasn't worth it. The cilantro, onion, lime mixture was great but we didn't need as much as was called for. Overall, the recipe is about the marinade and meat and that was awesome!
could do without the cheese but overall it's delicious we also smoked it which added a depth of flavor

Though these tacos were a huge hit, like many others have said, this wasn't really what I would think of as authentic carne asada. It was definitely a fabulous meal nonetheless and earns 5 stars however. I modified the salsa ingredients after mixing up the recipe ingredients however, as the salsa was quite bland to my taste, and too spicy. I added about 2 tablespoons of white wine vinegar, 1 tsp of salt, and a can of Italian style tomatoes. Brine time on the meat was about 4 hours. I also cooked the meat in a bit of canola oil on a cast iron griddle over a gas grill set to high, and searing hot. I used a hamburger press on each piece of meat to ensure thorough caramelization, and the flavor profile and depth, while not what I consider 'authentic', was nothing short of amazing. Once the meat was done, I heated up the tortillas on the same griddle for about 45-60 seconds per side. This recipe is definitely worth keeping, and I'll be making this dish many times.

Great recipe. I only made 1 change with cutting up the beef before marinating it. 
I served it with the Spoon licking lime jalapeno aioli on this site.
The closest I have found to authentic carne asada from the border of Mexico! Absolutely delicious!

I did the meat marinade as per the recipe except I ended up marinating it for about two days. It was one of the most tender and flavorful princes of meat I’ve ever made. I actually used a small sirloin steak as it was just for me. I had some left over refried beans and homemade salsa which I put on the tacos and added a slice of avocado. Without a doubt the best tacos I’ve made. Thanks so much for the recipe. I’m sure I’ll make it again.
The onion relish was the best part of this! I just used jarred salsa, topped with cheese and sour cream.
This is great, have made it many times with chicken and steak.

I apologize because I didn't have ingredients for step 3 and 4 so I skipped them, but it was still very good. I will get ingredients and follow recipe then edit my review. Who knew raw onions marinated in lime juice could be so good? Oh, I also used sirloin cause that's all I had.

My entire family loved this! The only thing we did differently is we used corn tortillas and fried them in about 1/3 cup of vegetable oil for a few minutes so they are slightly stiff. Will be a recurring meal for us!
Good, would make again!
It’s an amazing recipe! I’ve tried so many different carne asada recipes but this one turned out better than I expected. This one is a keeper!
Grill it instead of pan frying it - you won’t be disappointed.

This recipe is amazing! I used it to make steak quesadillas. I marinated the steak for about 16 hours, we used fresh flank steak. Probably the best steak taco meat I've ever had and that goes for eating at authentic restaurants as well. Thanks for sharing the recipe. I have saved it and will be using this regularly on taco Tuesday! I tried to upload pictures in the app but it just kept freezing and shutting down.
This is our family go-to for carne asada. We make a bulk amount of the spice mix, label it and keep it on hand for easy last minute meals!
It was delicious. I marinated it all day, then needed to cook it fast, so I threw it in my air fryer. Turned out great and had a nice char on it. Really solid marinade. Will use again.
This was amazing
Great recipe. We use the marinade on steak and chicken all the time.
Loved it. Doubled the recipe. Did 1lb shrimp, 2.5lb steak and 2.5lb chicken. Used same marinade for all three. Was amazing. The relish was great. The salsa got rave reviews.
amazing

I made some substitutes as my family isn’t a fan of Jalapeño. We switched it out for green pepper, when it came time for the roasting process I just added some ciratcha to give it the needs spice. I left out the white pepper. My family also isn’t a fan of Cilantro so I swapped that out for parsley semi dried, I added red pepper flakes and roasted garlic spice. Mixed with the onions, We also did not have limes. 2 limes squeezed will get you about 4 table spoons of lime juice. Lime is more acidic so i added 8 tablespoons of lemon juice instead.
This is a great recipe, I add lime zest to the marinade, adds another dimension of lime. I recommend grilling these over charcoal, letting it rest, cutting it then sauté on griddle to crisp it up.

I recently prepared 25 pounds of beef skirt steak for a party using this recipe and it was the hit of the party. I only made the marinade (step 1) and then grilled over mesquite lump charcoal which gave it oh so much more flavor. There is a local Taqueria chain here in AZ that is known for amazing mesquite grilled foods and I'm proud to say that my carne asada blows theirs out of the water. I've never had so many compliments of how awesome the smoky mesquite flavor brings to the meat. Perfect recipe!
Add more seasonings if you like it stronger

Fantastic! I made a half recipe, and I was concerned about a soy saucy flavor,so I reduced it slightly. Turned out great!

 Note: 3 or 4 habaneros also thrown in for the salsa kicks up the heat nicely.

I used the marinade for steak burrito's. The meat had amazing flavor. . No changes were made to the original recipe except for cutting the recipe in half for 1 lb. of meat. I marinaded the meat for 6 hours and cooked on a hot grill. Layered sliced meat, Mexican rice, corn salsa, cheese, black beans and sour cream for delicious Chipotle style burrito.
My family loves this recipe! We've also used chuck roast for the meat. Love it!

I made this for my house warming party and it was a hit!!! Everyone loved it and the kids were in heaven! Everyone knows how picky eaters kids can be... but all of them loved it! We grilled it and it was mouth watering.
I cooked it on the grill until medium rare - medium. Love this recipe.
Overall this dish is really great (I did skip the chili pods, however), but the marinade is AWESOME for the steak. I plan on using this marinade frequently for steak. YUM!
Amazing!!! This is a delicious dish. Only thing I changed was more salt to the salsa and cilantro. The meat was delicious! I also used quest Fresca for the cheese because you can’t go wrong.

Made this for a party of 38 and it was a hit. Per others recommendations I used flap meat. I have never made this before so I can’t compare this to another recipe or flap meat to flank steak, but based on the results I probably never will try anything different. I cooked these up on a flat top griddle on high and then sliced thin across the grain. Incredibly tender and flavorful. Just one word of warning, recipe shows this making 16 servings (or 3 oz per serving) so I tripled the recipe. We had no leftovers so I would recommend estimating this serving 12 (or 4 oz per serving).
Excellent marinade for the meat! I did not make the relish nor the salsa since they had too many ingredients we don't care for.

I followed the recipe making no changes and this was a HUGE hit. I used the marinade on skirt steak, boneless skinless chicken thighs & shrimp. I cooked all of the meats on the outside grill and everyone raved. Thank you for sharing

This just didn't turn out well. The steak looked really good when cooked and got a beautiful sear but when we ate it there was a strange film from the marinade on it. The chili flavor was a bit overpowering in my opinion. Disappointed.

This marinade was wonderful. Made it with no changes. Even my two picky eaters loved the steak. I cooked my steak in a hot cast iron skillet and then let it rest before slicing. So tender and great flavor. We will certainly be making this again.
Ever since moving from San Diego I have been craving authentic tasting carne aside tacos. This recipe finally answered my prayers.
Best marinade for flank steak tacos!
This is our go to steak taco recipe. Will never make it any other way!! Simply the best
Excellent flavor. I used lean, thinly slice chuck roast. I will reduce the amount of salt next time.
this recipe is amazing! My husband loved the beef!
Super good but I will say next time I will add only half a teaspoon of salt. Taste a bit to salty for me.
Good flavor but needs something besides thin slices to tenderize the meat.
Love these steak tacos! Very tasty. We added a slice of avocado and they were perfect. Definitely making this again.

I was torn on how to rate this. The meat was absolutely phenomenal. The only changes were that we soaked it in Coke prior to the marinade and grilled it. The salsa on the other hand was absolutely inedible - which is saying something in my family. I’ve decided it was the chili pods which ruined it, the flavor was abysmal.

This is my go-to recipe for carne asada, and everyone in my household loves it, especially the homemade salsa. I originally got this recipe from Genius Kitchen and was happy to see someone posted it on Allrecipes. I omit the cotija cheese and I can't stand raw onions, so I also skip making the onion relish. For more tender meat, top sirloin is also good. Using flank steak is good if you want to have leftovers for later in the week.
Love it! Followed the recipe exactly and I’m making it for the 3rd time in 3 weeks. Hubby loves it

I didn't have time to marinate any steak so I just added the vinegar, soy sauce, minced garlic and seasonings to a skillet with leftover sirloin that I had cut up real small and let it cook down until the liquid was gone. Ohhh Myyyy!!! These were the best tacos I have had in a long while and the best ever homemade! This recipe is definitely a keeper. (Now I'm trying it to flavor some chicken for my Arroz con pollo).

I just made the marinade/meat in this recipe. It was really good! The only thing I did differently was use chipotle chili powder instead of regular. I think next time (and there will be a next time) I'll either use low sodium soy sauce or regular soy sauce and omit the salt. It was just a little too salty, but didn't stop anyone from devouring it! Thanks for the recipe!
Authentic Mexican cuisine, delicious!
Great recipe! Only change I will make next time, for my own taste, is using only 1 lime for marinade. Too zingy for me lol.
I think this is really good just the way it's written.
amazing! my family loved it

This recipe is amazing! My boyfriend is what you would consider a connoisseur of tacos and he commented that these were hands down the best tacos he's ever had, and this man has had many many a tacos.
I only made the meat, but it was pretty spectacular and I have faith the rest of this recipe would have been as well.
I only made the meat, but it was pretty spectacular and I have faith the rest of this recipe would have been as well.
Loved this! My brother in law kept raving that they were some of the best tasting tacos he had. It's a keeper.

Really loved this carne asada recipe and have used it faithfully whenever time allowed. However, in a pinch, one can make an excellent carne asada recipe in less than 20 minutes by simply grilling your steak (skirt steak is the best) with lots of soy sauce and olive oil along with generous splashes of lime juice and adobo and onion powder. I did not believe it would be as good as this but had steak in the fridge needing to be used and it was almost 100 degrees where we live in Oregon this past week (who wants to grill in 100 degree weather after a 10-hour day at the office?!). My shortcut was just as good, perhaps even better, and took me far less time. So, while this recipe is great, don't knock your shortcut methods as well!

Really loved this carne asada recipe and have used it faithfully whenever time allowed. However, in a pinch, one can make an excellent carne asada recipe in less than 20 minutes by simply grilling your steak (skirt steak is the best) with lots of soy sauce and olive oil along with generous splashes of lime juice and adobo and onion powder. I did not believe it would be as good as this but had steak in the fridge needing to be used and it was almost 100 degrees where we live in Oregon this past week (who wants to grill in 100 degree weather after a 10-hour day at the office?!). My shortcut was just as good, perhaps even better, and took me far less time. So, while this recipe is great, don't knock your shortcut methods as well!

These were unbelievably salty. It is 3 stars, because I may have screwed something up. I’m going to try with a different cut of meat that isn’t pre sliced and see if that makes a difference. Unfortunately I am nervous about going it, because we had to pretty much completely throw this meal away and eat a frozen pizza.

I love this recipe and have used it for years. I just got a new Grill so here we go again. I add a couple of tweeks but I basically follow the recipe. For the two limes juiced, I use one lime and one lemon both juiced and zested-add zest to marinade. I also add the juice of one orange (or a 1/4 juice). For the chili powder, I use Chipotle (Or Ancho for a milder heat, more smoky flavor) and I add 1 t. of granulated toasted onion powder (Penzey's). I also only use Flap Meat. I feel this is is a tad more rounded in flavor with the extra citrus notes. I only sometimes make the new mexico chili sauce but quite often I just use something store bought.
Love love love. My family beg me to make this at least once a month.
It tasted OK, but definitely not authentic. I followed the recipe exactly as it written.
It wasn't bad. Instead of spooning the "salsa" over the meat I simmered the meat in it, then served with a slotted spoon.

I used this marinade on some shaved beef I picked up at Trader Joe's, and it was a hit. I reduced the recipe amounts because I had less meat than called for. Just used the proportions as a rough guide - used a little less vinegar to suit our tastes.
Love this recipe every time! We grill it to medium rare and then cut it to keep
Excellent recipe!! I wouldn't change a thing. Make sure you have really good corn tortillas. I purchased mine at a local Mexican restaurant.

We use this marinade at least twice a month for flank steak, chicken breasts, or chicken thighs and it always comes out so good and flavorful. We usually start the marinade first thing in the morning and get the meat on the grill for dinner. It's absolutely delicious.
Marinade excellent!! will definately remake these!! next time maybe for fajitas or burritos... mmmm
This recipe is a delight! Made it to the 'T' and it was wonderful. We didn't make the puree. We're lazy... However, I highly recommend it!

This is actually a really good marinate and how it is done in Mexico. By using all dry ingredients to marinate for two hours, cooking it outdoors over hickory not mesquite, then dicing the meat into small eatable pieces, you will have authentic Carne Asasda tacos less the work that this video made it to be - Cheers!
Used this marinade on chicken - it was excellent!
The marinade was amazing! Has anyone tries to use the marinade with chicken? If so, how did it turn out?
The absolute best carne asada tacos. When I make them EVERYONE raves that they are better than any restaurant they have been to.

My husband and I have been looking for a Great carne asada recipe and we’ve finally found it! He made it for dinner tonight, followed the recipe, no substitutions. He did forget to put the white vinegar in. We grilled the meat on our Traegar grill. FANTASTIC!!!
I lovvvvvve this- exactly the way the recipe states and also with my own alterations as a base recipe at times.

loved it, used chipotle pepper instead of dried new Mexican chiles since we did not have any and it turned out amazing! will make again! 
kid and husband approved.

I followed the recipe exactly. It was pretty good. I will make again, but add a few adjustments to tweak to my family's tastes. Also, I paired the taco with a jicama slaw (recipe on this website) and the combination was really good, especially with a slice of avocado.
I made it just like the recipe says and it is heavenly. I have been making it for a few months now and never any problems. Just amazing tacos.
I made it just like the recipe says and it is heavenly. I have been making it for a few months now and never any problems. Just amazing tacos.

Had friends over last night and made these tacos. Everyone absolutely loved them. Used rump steak, as didn't have any flank/ skirt in UK supermarket. Cut into small cubes & marinated overnight...tender & delicious! Added in a bit of guac too. Nicest tacos I've had since last went to LA.
I was very disappointed in this recipe. It was a cross between Mexican street tacos and Asian tacos, more on the Asian side.

I slice the meat before putting in marinade, and let it sit about an hour. Gives more flavor. Other than that, this recipe is spot on. I absolutely love it, and everyone I've invited over thinks so too!

This is my go-to marinade for steak. We love it so much that we call it “the clutch marinade.” The only thing I do differently is include the cilantro in the marinade and blend it before pouring over the meat, like another reviewer suggested. Thanks for the recipe and tip-we love it!

I made this recipe with skirt steak instead of flank steak only because Albertsons was out of flank. Overall it turned out really really good. The marinate was amazing and added a lot of flavor to the meat. Super good recipe and super easy to make. Will add this to our weekly meal plan for sure

I wish I would've paid more attention to the reviews and cut back on the soy sauce. I feel like this should be served with stir fry vegetables. I also was at a loss for fresh tomatoes / jalapenos...so I put a can of tomatoes/fire roasted chilies / jalapenos and one fresh onion with a pinch of sugar. I must say, this worked well however, the soy sauce was major prevalent in the flavor of the meat. Oh yeah, I also grilled the meat. Cheers!

The meat was excellent, rave reviews from everyone. Marinated for 7 or so hours, we grilled ours with charcoal then cut it into pieces. I didn't love the salsa, it was just ok but may have done something wrong? (it's also not vegetable season) The relish was a hit with all, even the kids. Will make again.

The marinade is spot on and the salsa on top made with two chipotle peppers in adobo sauce deseeded instead of the jalapeños and dried peppers made it perfect. A little guac on top evened out the spice. This was SO good!!!!

I loved this recipe! The only thing I would change is I wished I had trimmed the flank steak before seasoning it because the meat was somewhat tough where there was still fat. I also would love to try it again but in a slow cooker so the meat would be more tender. Other than that, flavor was good and the toppings were great!
This is fantastic! This is the closest recipe that I have found to something authentic. I do add sliced oranges, orange juice, sliced jalapenos, and fresh cilantro to the marinade.

This recipe, the marinade especially, is an excellent recipe! The beef is so tender & flavorful, you won't want to have steak tacos any other way! The first time i made the tacos & the salsa was for a get together at my home with several members of my husband's family. I didn't want to go the easy route & just order pizza, so i decided on a taco bar with steak & chicken tacos. This recipe was a hit with everyone, and my mother-in-law raved about the smokey chipotle salsa! To this day each time i make tacos my husband always asks if i'm making the "awesome steak tacos." I have the steak marinating in the fridge as i type this for tomorrow night's dinner, can't wait!

I made this for my husband, who is half Mexican, and he absolutely loved it! Of course he said "it didn't taste exactly how they did when I was growing up, but pretty close!" I will definitely be making these again. Only bad part is soooooo many ingredients. Excellent taste!!

I only made the meat portion, but it was awesome!!! I made the marinade per the recipe. Only change I made was to grill it on the BBQ. Came out great. I cut it all into little squares or rectangles and froze in baggies per how many tacos on mini corn tortillas we would eat for one meal. Then I heated those small portions as needed. We also garnished them very simply -- like they do at our favorite Mexican restaurant - with just chopped onion, salsa verde and cilantro. YUM!!!

I only made the meat portion, but it was awesome!!! I made the marinade per the recipe. Only change I made was to grill it on the BBQ. Came out great. I cut it all into little squares or rectangles and froze in baggies per how many tacos on mini corn tortillas we would eat for one meal. Then I heated those small portions as needed. We also garnished them very simply -- like they do at our favorite Mexican restaurant - with just chopped onion, salsa verde and cilantro. YUM!!!

I just made this with seitan instead of meat. Skipped the cheese, totally vegan. I only soaked the seitan for about 15-20 minutes because it is all I had time for. Used storebought salsa and guac as toppings. Really quick and delicious. Will make again and again.
This was so delicious. I will definitely make this again.
It was good...next time I will use less vinegar than the recipe listed
My family loved, super easy wish i would have made more.
